com.petpet.c3po.api.dao
Interface PersistenceLayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultPersistenceLayer, MongoPersistenceLayer
public interface PersistenceLayer

The persistence layer interface offers some common methods for interacting with the underlying database. All implementing classes require a default constructor.

Author:
Petar Petrov

Method Detail

clearCache

void clearCache()
Clears the current cache of the application. This includes the Cache, but also any other cached information that the backend provider might have stored (e.g. cached statistics and aggregations).

close

void close()
           throws C3POPersistenceException
This method will be called once before the applications ends running.

Throws:
C3POPersistenceException

count

<T extends Model> long count(Class<T> clazz,
                             Filter filter)
Counts the number of objects of the given type that match the filter. If the filter is null, the count of all objects of that type is retrieved.

Parameters:
clazz - the type of objects
filter - the filter.
Returns:
the number of objects corresponding to that type and filter.

establishConnection

void establishConnection(Map<String,String> config)
                         throws C3POPersistenceException
This method will be called upon initialisation of the application. The map will contain all configurations (loaded from the config file) starting with the prefix 'db'. Example: db.host=192.168.0.1

Parameters:
config - the configuration
Throws:
C3POPersistenceException

find

<T extends Model> Iterator<T> find(Class<T> clazz,
                                   Filter filter)
Finds objects corresponding to the supplied filter and type. The type has to implement the Model interface. Retrieves an iterator for the objects. Note that depending on the underlying implementation this method might fetch a lot of data from the database.

Parameters:
clazz - the generic type of the iterator
filter - the optional filter.
Returns:
a typed iterator for the given type of objects.

distinct

<T extends Model> List<String> distinct(Class<T> clazz,
                                        String f,
                                        Filter filter)
Returns the distinct values for the given property (in string form). If the passed filter is not null, then it is applied on the collection before

Parameters:
clazz - the type of the objects to look at.
f - the field for which the distinct values have to be applied
filter - the filter that has to be applied on the data before the distinct operation is executed
Returns:
the distinct values for a given property

getCache

Cache getCache()
Gets a cache object.

Returns:
the cache of the application.

getNumericStatistics

NumericStatistics getNumericStatistics(Property p,
                                       Filter filter)
                                       throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                                              IllegalArgumentException
Returns statistics for the given numeric property for all elements according to the given filter. The values of the property have to have a numeric data type as the computation might/will involve mathematical calculations. As this method is a higher-level query it can only support numeric properties and the Element.class

Parameters:
p - the property for which the statistcs will be created.
filter - the filter to apply.
Returns:
NumericStatistics object containing statistics like: min, max, avg, sd, var, etc.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the operation is not supported by the implementing backend
IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are not appropriate, e.g. if the datatype of the property is not of a numeric type.

getValueHistogramFor

<T extends Model> Map<String,Long> getValueHistogramFor(Property p,
                                                        Filter filter)
                                      throws UnsupportedOperationException
Returns a property value histogram for the given property and type and respecting the given filter. As this method is a higher-level query it should only support the Element class.

Parameters:
p - the property for which the value histogram will be created in the corresponding model object
filter - the filter that has to be applied before the operation is conducted
Returns:
a map with the distinct values as keys (strings) and their occurrences as map-values (long)
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the current persistence layer cannot create such a histogram.

insert

<T extends Model> void insert(T object)
Inserts the given object to the underlying data store.

Parameters:
object - the object to store.

isConnected

boolean isConnected()
Whether or not there is an established connection to the database.

Returns:
true if there is a connection, false otherwise.

remove

<T extends Model> void remove(Class<T> clazz,
                              Filter filter)
Removes the objects of the given type that match the filter from the underlying data store. If the filter is null, then all objects are removed.

Parameters:
clazz - the type of object to remove
filter - the filter to match. Can be null.

remove

<T extends Model> void remove(T object)
Removes the given object from the underlying data store.

Parameters:
object - the object to remove.

setCache

void setCache(Cache c)
Sets the cache to the passed cache.

Parameters:
c - the cache to use.

update

<T extends Model> void update(T object,
                              Filter f)
Inserts or updates the given object to the underlying data store. Note that if the filter is null the backend provider might not be able to infer which object should be updated. Make sure the filter uniquely identifies all objects that have to be updated with the passed one.

Parameters:
object - the object to update.
f - the filter that uniquely identifies the object.
